title: iFFALCON 79.97 cm (32 inch) HD Ready LED Smart Android TV with Google assistant tv HDR 10 and Dolby Audio  (32F2A)

product_specification.In The Box: 1N LED TV, 1N Stand, 1N Audio Cable, 1N User Manual, 1N Warranty Card , 1N - Remote, 2N - Batteries
product_specification.Supported Video Formats: H.265/H.264, MPEG1/2/4, WMV, VC1, VP8, VP9
product_specification.Other Video Features:
Micro Dimming
Dynamic Contrast
Sports Mode
Noise Reduction
product_specification.Supported App - Others: Voot, ZEE5, Alt Balaji, Sun NXT, Hungama Play, Eros Now, Jio Cinema, Sony Liv
product_specification.Content Providers: Google Play Store, Google Game, Google Music, Google Movie&TV, Netflix, YouTube, T-cast, Mediacenter
product_specification.Covered in Warranty: Defect Arising Out of Faulty or Defective Material or Workmanship. Parts and Labour Costs are Covered
product_specification.Not Covered in Warranty: Damages Resulting from Un-authorised Adaptations or Adjustment. External Accessories (Such as Battery, Cable Etc). Damages Caused to the Product by Accident, Lightening, Ingress of Water, Fire, Dropping or Excessive Shock. If Product Serial No has been Altered, Removed or Defaced. Damages Caused by Improper Installation/ 3rd Party Equipment or Software/Media Used. If Product is Used in Commercial, Business, Industrial, Educational and Rental Applications
product_specification.Installation & Demo Details: We'll facilitate the installation and demo through authorized service engineer at your convenience The installation will be done within 48 hours of delivery of the TV. The service engineer will install your new TV, either on wall mount or on table top. The wall mount is not included in the box and will be chargeable. The engineer will also help you understand your new TV's features. The process generally covers: Wall-mounted or table-top installation, as requested. Physical check of all ports, including power and USB ports. Accessories also checked. Demonstration of features and settings Quick run-through on how to operate the TV.

product_description.A+ Grade HD Ready Panel: The better the picture-quality of a TV, the more entertaining is your viewing experience - isn't it? And, that's why this TV comes with an A+ Grade HD Ready Panel, which ensures that the picture-quality is detailed and crystal-clear to make for an immersive viewing experience.
product_description.HDR 10: An accurate reproduction of light and dark shades helps you enjoy next-level HDR content, such as your favourite movies and videos, from almost all sources.

review:
Ok firstly let me start by saying that I had to wait 12 days from the time of ordering to the time of receiving the product. Installation by Jeeves was scheduled 5 days from me receiving the product, I had to mail and contact them regularly to get installation done the next day, I don't blame them cause I had ordered during the big billion days so it was natural that it was going to delay but I feel that they could have promptly have increased their staff during this period.

Now, coming to the product itself.
If you r looking for a perfect budget TV for your living room and a small room, bang on this is the best product you get in the market today. I was confused between iffalcon blaupunkt and MI 4c pro, and let me admit here that I am a Xiaomi fan. But still I made my choice with this TV firstly because it was cheaper than 4c pro and blaupunkt, and secondly it was from the world's one of the top brand TCL. Thus the trust factor was there. I must admit that the product is just fantastic to use. You get just about everything that you need in today's life to be more that satisfied with the product. To make it simple I would list the pros and cons as tht would make it easy for you if you need a quick yes or a no to decide .

Pros:
-price is affordable
-sound is crisp and clear
-videos are sharp
-supports Netflix, all you Netflix lovers you get dedicated Netflix button on remote
-latest android support
-picture quality is good (there is a con too so wait for it)
-has all ports that you need in life
-light weight and not bulky
-supports voice commands is a bonus and a major plus
-batteries inside the box, well this is because mi 4c pro doesn't
-2 remotes in the box, one smart and one regular .. so now no fighting over remote folks ...
-bluetooth support
-wifi and inbuilt cast present too

Cons:
-brightness is low so if your room is having too much sunlight you might not like the quality.
-sound is good but low as it has 16watt speakers compared to 20watts in other brands
-just one usb port, I feel they should have given 2 atleast
-if you do not have hd set top box , you may feel the TV to be ok . I suggest you do connect hd for best experience . However it's a personal choice, without hd too it's not bad.
-you have to type everything letter by letter to search or input
-tends to restart sometimes
-initially wen I turned on the TV it had a weird noise which was irritating, background noise, so if that's with you I suggest you remove the plastic around and also do a system update , it vanished after that . I mention it as a con as some of you might not be technically strong enough to recognise and this noise was seriously irritating and company should have addressed this while packaging . I am mentioning this as many have written about this noise and thus I have solved it, if you are able to do it too it would be great.

Final verdict. Just go for it if you are not wanting to waste more money for the brands like Samsung LG as the product is just great and way ahead of competition in turns of all the things . Appreciate your time

Good budget certified android TV. Points to consider:
1. Picture Quality (3 out of 5): There are lot to offer, too much picture setting options provided. Required to explore & set as per your convenience. There are options like HDR, micro dimming, motion clarity but not to get most of them in experience considering size (32") & budget.
2. Sound (5 out of 5): Just one word awesome. I can say best part of it much better than expected. Options like 5 band graphic equalizer, bass boost, pcm, volume leveling all are good and works to. & yes Dolby's audio.
3. System setup (3 out of 5): OK but more easier options required. Even sometimes feels confusing. Only plus point is that whatever setting you did in the end can be applicable for all sources as option provided.
4. Connection options (3 to 4 out of 5, provided what & how you actually want to connect): If you just to want basic connectivity like using Netflix (1 month trial available or if you are having an active plan), Hot star, SonyLiv, Yupptv, Erosnow, Jiocinema, YouTube, etc then it's superb works good with lan or WiFi network. Note: Amazon prime not work at all & not supported anyhow.
*Chromecast available but too much lagging.
So, its good with android TV apps with basic network connectivity options.
5. About Android (2 out of 5): Much disappointed considering it's branded as certified Android TV. Android version is basic Oreo with no system updates even Android security path is much older (August 2018) no updates available for this. This is not acceptable at all with being certified Android (apps updates available and working too but as technology changes inevitable much more required).
6. Performance (4 out of 5): In this budget the performance is good. I am used it with SonyLiv, Hotstar, YouTube's with uptime more than 10 hrs in last 4 days. Installed several apps, uninstalled several apps, also Tvgaurd app provided is good to use to keep good health of TV.
7. Delivery & Installation (3 out of 5): delivery time is more (12 days) installation is very short timed no proper demo about features, I explored all this options self after installation. It's bad.
******** Final world: I go for it only for its budget. If budget is good I would explored more options. But in this budget I am happy with this (just enjoying jiosaavn with awesome sound).***********

I'm writing this review after using this TV for a past month.
Let me divide this review in Pros and Cons

Pros
1. Sound quality is really good. It has dolby atmos speakers. So, it gives a cinematic surround sound experience.
2. Picture quality is really good if you're streaming HD content from YouTube or Netflix.
3. Wifi connectivity is fast.
4. Built in Chromecast.
5. Price is affordable

Cons
1. Although it's called Android TV but you'll not get full fledged Android experience. Can't install majority of Apps from Playstore.
2. SD channels are not clear and sharp.
3. Sometimes the UI of the TV hangs up.

Still, it's a decent buy at such a low price range. I'm not disappointed.

At the price point this is the best value for money. This has certified android TV version and enough 1.5 gb ram along with 8gb internal memory ( 4.7 gb user available). I got the 2019 version and that comes with one remote only that is the voice search smart Bluetooth remote. Display quality is ok with good saturation and natural looking colors. Build looks sturdy and bezels are quite narrow. All in all TV looks much more premium. Speakers are ok and sufficiently loud for medium sized room. UI is stock android and apps can be easily side-loaded. This comes with 2 HDMI ports but one USB which was a letdown. But I found a workaround for it. This TV supports USB 2.0 hub and I bought one from local market. Now it can support multi USB devices and I verified 3 devices working together - Pen drive 16 GB, USB mouse and USB keyboard. Even the multimedia buttons on keyboard work. Wifi works perfect without any issues and you can connect Bluetooth headphones too.

Clarity on SD DTH is good enough. Couldn't test HD DTH as need to upgrade my connection. However, other apps like Youtube work awesome in Full HD. Netflix works perfect and easy to use via direct button on remote.

Now moving over to some cons. Display is not so bright and direct sunlight can cause issues as brightness levels are not on par, just 280 nits. Some TVs in this range come with 400+ nits brightness. Sound is alright but not so loud and could have been tad better but can live with it. Also there are no physical buttons on TV so if remote malfunctions then you can't even turn it on.

Now some myth-busting.
1) I read many reviews stating restarting problem - I never faced it. TV remains all and never crashes.
2) Sound breaking at high volume - Nope volume can go high upto 100 and still doesnt break/sound awful
3) Remote batteries running out in days - nope batteries run fine. I am using it for over a month and still working good with original batteries that it came with
4) Also TV goes to last source directly like HDMI/AVI. If set top box is connected then it powers on to it

The product is good that too at a reasonable cost.The features which i liked most are Hotstar & YouTube chromcasting. You will get blue lines vertically if the interconnection speed is low otherwise the picture quality is also good.

I have been using this product for nearly 2-3 weeks now and here is my review.

Speed and Display : (Average )
I was earlier using MI Box for my old 24inch inch TV for more than an year and i could see there is a huge difference in the response time and app loading comparing both. MI BOX was extremely fast in response time. From switch on to playing a video in youtube this TV takes more than 30 secs which i feel a bit slow .
Also i could find picture quality to be little avg compared to MI Box .

Playback : ( Good )
It detected my HDD and i was able to play the contents at ease. only drawback is the interface could have been better for HDD playback.Surprisingly it detected my old deleted pics in the HDD which i am not able to view in laptop until now.

Sound (Average ) is average but since i have connected my Creative 2.1 speakers to this , i felt no issues at all.

Finally , I would suggest to go for MI TV 32 inch which is 1k higher than this since we could have a better android experience compared to this.

My verdict - 3 / 5

First of all.. the difference between this Tv and most others in this price segment are.. This Tv runs Android OS for TV and most others run some form of linux or other OS. What this means if you have play store here and can install apk files as well. So, now that's out of the way let do the ProS and Cons.
Pros :
1. Functionality is Great, comes with two remotes. One for normal usage and other for Smart Uses which supports Google Voice
2. Most Apps are can be installed from play store or can be side loaded.
3. Chromecast is inbuilt and works flawlessly with Mobile, PC or Mac,
4. Two Hdmi ports, I connected with PC and Fire Tv Stick, Works perfectly,
5. Audio is very loud for its size, no need for external speakers in most cases.
6. Form factor is great, very slim and slim bezzles.
7. Although it's low resolution panel but supports smart features like HDR and Looks Great for such a low price point.
8. Unlike Mi TV, wall mount is free.
9. Audio output via 3.5 mm jack is superb.
Cons.
1. Although sound is loud but its not great. Sounds shrill some times.
2. Does not support prime Videos, Even side loading won't work in some cases. Play store apps are also limited if u are digging deep.
3. Does not support all mouse and keyboard, also Only one USB port makes it hard. At least two would have been great.
4. Does not support large storage devices. My 1tb external HDD wont work
5. Android OS for tv is almost Stock, Would have preferred a little bit of polished version like Mi's PatchWall ANdroid.

Over all its great for this price segment, better than MI 32 on flipkart. but Mi 4C pro is better but priced much higher.

Hello guys,
This product is awesome. 100% Value for money. Before placing order of this TV, I read some reviews in which, some users are facing some problems i.e.
1. Unusual sound from speakers while watching videos on YouTube,
2. While on AV mode connected to STB, the TV continuously flickering.
These are some common issues I read while reviewing reviews of customers. I also faced these issues but, these issues are very easy to solve even that "second" issue is the issue of STBs, and not of the TV. Now,
Solution for 1st issue: Check for system updates as well as App updates from play store. Go to "Settings (from home screen)>About>System Update" for system update and sign-in with your Google Account to enable play store services.
Solution for 2nd issue: If your tv keeps flickering while on STB(Set-Top Box), then change the stb settings. Search for AV settings in your STB(may vary for different STBs) where you've to change the "PAL" to "NTSC". That's it.
In the end, I conclude that this TV is amazing, best speakers, very responsive, no hanging issues at all. Maybe for some users, the brightness of the TV might be an issue if they place TV in a room where amount of sunlight is very good, but it is not bad at all. Regarding the price point, it's the best Android TV under 15k. Go for it!
In a simple word it's mind-blowing...

Hardware is slow much like most Android TVs.

As the system resource is quite less installing a lot of apps can cause issues.
Some bundled apps cannot be removed or disabled.

However i startee facing issues after few days.
The tv started turning off randomly after 1-2 mins whenever switched on.
Removed the battery from remote and still found tv switching off. I did a factory reset still no help.
Tried on another power socket in wall..
Used without any hdmi cable connected - worked for few days and Once again problem resurfaced.
Tv shut down by itself and when switched ON using remote again it has the same shutdown problem.
No shut down interval set or any setting such like. Its completely the fault of TV. Removed the HdMI cable and watching Netflix. Again switched off by itself.
Now removing the power cable and reconnecting to wall socket...
Finally I discovered that this TV dont have a proper voltage stabilizing module thats why whenever anyone uses the Heater in the kitchen the TV turns off. So that means again I need to buy a Voltage stabilizer extra.
